private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are vowels: A E I
I can only interact with the top block of a stack and only move one block at a time
I begin in the environment with access to observe public information and my movement restriction
vowel_agent.goal: Achieve the target tower where A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, and K is on the table.

private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are consonants: B C D F G H J K
I can only interact with the top block of a stack and only move one block at a time
I begin in the environment with access to observe public information and my movement restriction
consonant_agent.goal: Achieve the target tower where A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, and K is on the table.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and integrate their observations and partial plans
I am responsible for producing the final PDDL domain and problem formatted for the FastDownwards solver
orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that enables FastDownwards to compute a plan achieving the target tower A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J on K with K on the table.

public_information: There are 11 uniquely labeled blocks: A B C D E F G H I J K
Agents can only move the top block of a stack and only one block at a time
One agent may only move vowel-labelled blocks and the other may only move consonant-labelled blocks
Initial stacks are: Stack1 bottom C then E then I then H then D then F then G top, Stack2 bottom B then A then K then J top
The goal is a single tower with bottom K on the table and then J I H G F E D C B A above it in that order

analysis.system_prompt: You are an expert in block manipulation and local planning. Based on the public information and your private capability to move only vowel-labelled blocks, provide observations about reachable blocks, a prioritized set of allowed moves you can perform, and any local constraints you detect. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on clarifying what you can move and short local action sequences.
analysis.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You operate in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private knowledge: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Your objective is the global goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Provide a clear observation of which stacks and top blocks are currently accessible to you, list allowed move actions you can perform on your accessible blocks, and give short local sequences that progress toward the goal. If information is missing, state what is missing rather than making assumptions.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an expert in block manipulation and local planning. Based on the public information and your private capability to move only consonant-labelled blocks, provide observations about reachable blocks, a prioritized set of allowed moves you can perform, and any local constraints you detect. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on clarifying what you can move and short local action sequences.
analysis.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You operate in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private knowledge: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Your objective is the global goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Provide a clear observation of which stacks and top blocks are currently accessible to you, list allowed move actions you can perform on your accessible blocks, and give short local sequences that progress toward the goal. If information is missing, state what is missing rather than making assumptions.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL. Integrate the local reports from the two agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Keep the agents actions distinct and explicit in the domain so that one agent's actions are annotated as vowel_agent actions and the other's as consonant_agent actions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownwards compatibility.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator and must integrate the two agents reports to produce a final PDDL domain and problem that achieves the global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Here is the first agent report: {report_vowel_agent}. Here is the second agent report: {report_consonant_agent}. Ensure action definitions keep vowel_agent and consonant_agent actions distinct and respect the top-only and one-block-at-a-time constraints. Think step by step, resolve naming ambiguities, and output a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that FastDownwards can solve. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
